evaluations.notes: No changes made between raw and clean samples. Text appears clean with no OCR errors identified in the cleaned version.
Clean sample adds contextual phrase at beginning. No OCR errors visible in cleaned text. Text flows naturally with proper grammar and spelling.

Minor errors corrected: relations-ship to relationship (hyphenation) and DecemberHOME to December HOME (spacing). Lesson numbering IIL corrected to III with proper punctuation. Cleaned text is highly readable with excellent restoration.
One character substitution error corrected: &gg to egg. Significant text reorganization performed. Remaining text is clean and well-structured. Single character error was critical correction.
Minor punctuation error: question mark changed to em-dash in AMERICAN ARCHITECTURE. This improves readability. Text is otherwise excellent quality.

Multiple punctuation/structural corrections: Go home return to Go home, return (critical); homeward this time to homeward. This time (sentence separation); two ounce to two-ounce (hyphenation); last night also to last night; also (semicolon); continued "The to continued, "The. All corrections improve readability and grammar.

batch_summary.overall_assessment: Excellent cleanup quality overall. Average quality score 98.5/100. Most errors are minor punctuation and formatting improvements. Only 1 critical error impacting clarity. The OCR cleanup process successfully eliminated most OCR artifacts while preserving original text meaning and structure.
